column4: Just upgraded to Natty on test computer. Is it at all interesting to report found bugs at this stage? I mean since it's still in Alpha...
yes log bugs, discussion and support in #ubuntu+1
if you don't reboot it doesn't affect the OS, you just have a kernel update which needs one to load the new stuff, that'ss all. The OS can happily run fiorever more without you rebooting
Yeah, I can still see a point in being told before committing the update that it will require a reboot to complete
you cn add the 64bit flash ppa and get native 64bit flash
I know, but since flash 11 is provided in Ubuntu repos I thought that would be enough
remove all flash plugin packages you have installed, works a treat
xangua "Adobe flash 11 providing amd64 support has been released and is available from the ubuntu partner repository>"
It something SanDisk puts on usb sticks so you can have protable apps
try using dd to write from o to n, should kill it good
I have done that many times, doesn't help
could jam a magnet next to it as a last resort. I have ressurrected USB flash storage devices using a magnet.
